adjective.description: Of a person: inclined to adopt speculative or unsubstantiated views; having a tendency to be impractical, polemical, or opinionated.
Of a theory, piece of writing, etc.: characterized by speculative or unsubstantiated views; polemical or opinionated.
Originally slang. Pleasant or attractive in appearance; showy.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Henry Newman (1801–1890), theologian and cardinal. From view + -y.
